VII.i.2.B.6.a
.
Claimant’s Interest in Disavowing a Common Law Marriage
A claimant and their spouse may
live together in a jurisdiction recognizing common law marriages under circumstances meeting requirements for a common law marriage, and
choose
not
to recognize or report the marriage because the spouse has income or net worth that would adversely affect entitlement to benefits.
Important
:  The marriage
must
be established if it, in fact, exists.
title: M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section B - Establishing Common Law Marriages
citation: Part VII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section B
